00036 require_once('../lib/vars.php');
00037 require_once('../lib/view.php');
00038 
00039 class Dansguardian extends View
00040 {
00041     public $Model= 'dansguardian';
00042     public $Layout= 'dansguardian';
00043     
00044     function Dansguardian()
00045     {
00046         $this->LogsHelpMsg= _HELPWINDOW('These logs may be important for diagnosing web filter related problems.');
00047     }
00048     
00054     function SetSessionFilterGroup()
00055     {
00056         if ($_POST['Group']) {
00057             $group= $_POST['Group'];
00058         }
00059         else if ($_SESSION[$this->Model]['Group']) {
00060             $group= $_SESSION[$this->Model]['Group'];
00061         }
00062         else {
00063             $group= '1';
00064         }
00065 
00066         if ($this->Controller($output, 'GroupExists', $group)) {
00067             $_SESSION[$this->Model]['Group']= $group;
00068         }
00069         else {
00070             PrintHelpWindow(_NOTICE('Filter group not found').': '.$group, 'auto', 'ERROR');
00071         }
00072     }
00073 
00076     function PrintFilterGroupForm()
00077     {
00078         // Print the group form even if group not found, so user can change it
00079         ?>
00080         <table>
00081             <tr>
00082                 <td>
00083                     <form action="<?php echo $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] ?>" method="post">
00084                         <?php echo _TITLE('Group').':' ?>
00085                         <input type="text" name="Group" style="width: 20px;" maxlength="2" value=<?php echo $_SESSION[$this->Model]['Group'] ?> />
00086                         <input type="submit" name="ApplyGroup" value="<?php echo _CONTROL('Apply') ?>"/>
00087                     </form>
00088                 </td>
00089                 <td>
00090                     <?php
00091                     PrintHelpBox(_HELPBOX2('This shows the active group for this page. Use this form to change the active group.'), 400);
00092                     ?>
00093                 </td>
00094             </tr>
00095         </table>
00096         <?php
00097     }
00098 }

00116 
00117 0 = banned
00118 1 = filtered
00119 2 = unfiltered (exception)
00120 
00121 Only filter groups with a mode of 1 need to define phrase, URL, site, extension, mimetype and PICS lists; in other modes, these options are ignored to conserve memory.
00122 
00123 Defaults to 0 if unspecified.
00124 Unauthenticated users are treated as being in the first filter group.'),

00435 It will reduce searching speed somewhat so unless you have a local caching DNS server, leave it off and use the Blanket IP Block option in the bannedsitelist file instead.'),

00441 If a client computer is matched against an IP given in the lists, then the IP will be recorded in any log entries; if forward DNS is successful and a match occurs against a hostname, the hostname will be logged instead.
00442 It will reduce searching speed somewhat so unless you have a local DNS server, leave it off.'),

00465 $GeneralscanConfig= array(
00466     'maxcontentfiltersize' => array(
00467         'title' => _TITLE2('Max content filter size'),
00468         'info' => _HELPBOX2('Sometimes web servers label binary files as text which can be very large which causes a huge drain on memory and cpu resources.
00469 To counter this, you can limit the size of the document to be filtered and get it to just pass it straight through.
00470 This setting also applies to content regular expression modification.
00471 The value must not be higher than maxcontentramcachescansize
00472 The size is in Kibibytes - eg 2048 = 2Mb
00473 use 0 to set it to maxcontentramcachescansize'),
00474         ),
00475     'maxcontentramcachescansize' => array(
00476         'title' => _TITLE2('Max content ram cache scan size'),
00477         'info' => _HELPBOX2('This is only used if you use a content scanner plugin such as AV
00478 This is the max size of file that DG will download and cache in RAM.  After this limit is reached it will cache to disk.
00479 This value must be less than or equal to maxcontentfilecachescansize.
00480 The size is in Kibibytes - eg 10240 = 10Mb
00481 use 0 to set it to maxcontentfilecachescansize
00482 This option may be ignored by the configured download manager.'),

00491     'deletedownloadedtempfiles' => array(
00492         'title' => _TITLE2('Delete downloaded temp files'),
00493         'info' => _HELPBOX2('Delete file cache after user completes download
00494 When a file gets save to temp it stays there until it is deleted.
00495 You can choose to have the file deleted when the user makes a sucessful download. This will mean if they click on the link to download from the temp store a second time it will give a 404 error.
00496 You should configure something to delete old files in temp to stop it filling up.

00527 With this option enabled, the exception site/URL/regexpURL lists are also re-checked after replacement, making it possible for URL replacement to trigger exceptions based on them.

00594 As of 2.9.7.0, a warning will be issued to the user that the fancy DM may not be able to cache the entire file, and the file will continue to be downloaded to disk (but not scanned) until it reaches this size, at which point the user will simply have to re-download the file (the URL won\'t be scanned again).
